owl:Ontology.ontology:designedForOntologyTask:
This COVID-19 ontology is a data model for publishing COVID-19 data on the Web as a Graph.
The primary focuses of the model are: (1) COVID-19 cases: the data for COVID-19 cases (e.g., active, recovered, deceased, migrated) ondaily basis across the geo-location (district, state and country), available resources and requirements; (2) COVID-19 patient data: nationality, symptom, suspected level of covid -19 cases, covid-19 treatment facility, covid-19 clinical facility, patient's travel history, inter-personal relationships between patients, suspected transmission reason, tracking of patient test results, etc.
owl:Ontology.terms:creator: Biswanath Dutta (Indian Statistical Institute, India)
Michael DeBellis (Semantic Web Consultant, USA)
owl:Ontology.terms:title: CODO: COviD-19 Ontology for Cases and Patient information
owl:Ontology.mod:competencyQuestion: Some example competency questions: How many people recovered from COVId-19 in place p until date t? How many people died in country c? Give me the travel history of patient p? Give me the COVID-19 patients and their relationship, if any. Give me the COVID-19 patients who are in family relationships. Give me the primary reasons for the maximum number of COVID-19 patients. Give me the most prevalent symtopms of Severe COVID-19.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The patient admitted to the covid-19 dedicated facilities, like home, hotel, hospital, etc.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: admitted in

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The medical clinic where testing/ diagnosis for disease is available.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: clinical facility

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Two persons in co-worker relation.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: co-worker

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property to connect to the country wise metrics related to the casualities of the disease.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: country wise statistics

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The medical clinic where testing/ diagnosis for the COVID-19 Coronavirus disease is available.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: covid-19 clinical facility

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property to connect to the district wise metrics related to the casualities of the disease.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: district wise statistics

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A person is a domestic help to anothe person.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: domestic help

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The sister of your father or mother; the wife of your uncle.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasAunt

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A male with the same parents as someone else.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasBrother

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The diagnosis details of a patient.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has diagnosis

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A son of your brother or sister.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasNephew

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A daughter of your brother or sister.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasNiece

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates a place has a place part.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has part

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A generic property to store the relationships between persons.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has relationships

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A female person who has the same parents as another person.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasSister

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Two persons in married relationship.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: spouse

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A generic property to connect to the metrics related to the casualities of the disease.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has statistics

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Any sensation or change in bodily function that is experienced by a patient and is associated with a particular disease.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has symptom

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A patient has clinical test result.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has test result

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The brother of your father or mother; the husband of your aunt.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasUncle

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A place is part of another place.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is part of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A male relative.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: kinsman

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A female relative.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: kinswomen

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Patient's covid-19 clinical test result.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: laboratory test finding

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The location of for example where a person is situated, an organization (covid-19 dedicated facilities, medical clinics) is located, or the geographic coverage of a disease.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: location

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The most recent covid-19 clinical test result.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: most recent test result

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The next clinical test result of a patient.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: next test result

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The previous clinical test result of a patient.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: previous test result

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: An associate who shares a room with you.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: roommate

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A security guard of a person.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: security guard

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A property to connect to the state (province) wise metrics related to the casualities of the disease.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: state wise statistics

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The suspected reasons of catching covid-19 disease, for example, travel, attending a marriage anniversary, while treating a patient, infected famility member.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: suspected reasons of catching covid-19

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A generic property to store the travel history of a patient.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: travel history

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A suspected covid-19 patient travelled from a place, e.g., country/ state/ district.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: travelled from

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A suspected covid-19 patient travelled to a place, e.g., country/ state/ district.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: travelled to

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Gender of a person.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has gender

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Nationality of the person.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: nationality

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The peripheral capillary oxygen saturation, an estimate (in %) of the amount of oxygen in the blood.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: peripheral capillary oxygen saturation(SpO2)

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: An acronym.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: acronym

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number of active covid cases.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: active

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A patient admitted on a particular day and time.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: admitted on

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: An age of a person.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: age

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Tthe extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary (in sq. km.).
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: area

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: no. of bed shortage.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: no. of bed shortage

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: no. of beds needed.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: no. of beds needed

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number of covid cases.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: cases

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The country code. Example, "IND" for India.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: country code

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: covid-19 cases on a day
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: covid-19 case on

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The current status of the patient, for example: recovered, hospitalized, deceased.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: patient status

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Total no,. of active cases in Date 2 - total no. of active cases in Date 1
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: daily increased cases

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A particular day specified as the time something happens.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: date

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: number of deceased covid-19 patients.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: deceased

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The diagnosis took place on a day.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: diagnosed on

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The rate at which the heart beats; usually measured to obtain a quick evaluation of a person's health.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Heart rate

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: no. of icu bed shortage.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: no. of icu bed shortage

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: no. of invasive ventilators needed.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: no. of icu beds needed

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: no. of invasive ventilators needed.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: no. of invasive ventilators needed

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A generic property to store any metrics related to the covid-19 disease casualties and resources.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: metrics

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number of people migrated after recovery from the covid.
number of people migrated
The patient id
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: patient id

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: For humans, population density is the number of people per unit of area, usually quoted per square kilometre or square mile, and which may include or exclude for example areas of water or glaciers.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: population density

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Number of people recovered from covid.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: recovered

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The patient released on a day from a covid dedicated facility.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: released on

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Available/ required resource for covid treatment.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: resource

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Is the number of breaths a person take per minute.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: repiratory rate

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The data source based on which the statistics produced.
State (province) code. Example, "KL" of Kerala.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: state code

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The body temperature.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: temperature

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The test result date.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: test result on

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The weight.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: weight

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A name for some thing.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Physical address of the item.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: address

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The locality in which the street address is, and which is in the region. For example, BHEL Layout.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: address locality

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The latitude of a location. For example 37.42242
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: latitude

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The longitude of a location. For example -122.08585.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: longitude

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The postal code. For example, 560060
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: postal code

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The street address. For example, 1st Main, Muthurainagara.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: street address

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A symptom is a perceived change in function, sensation, loss, disturbance or appearance reported by a patient indicative of a disease.

Source: https://www.mohfw.gov.in/pdf/FinalGuidanceonMangaementofCovidcasesversion2.pdf
https://www.who.int/news-room/q-a-detail/q-a-coronaviruses
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Symptom

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Medical clinic where testing for the COVID-19 Coronavirus disease is available.
Covid testing facility
A facility, often associated with a hospital or medical school, that is devoted to the specific diagnosis and/or healthcare.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Medical clinic

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Disease caused by 2019 novel coronavirus
Disease caused by 2019-nCoV
Disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Any facility for providing care to COVID-19 patients.
source: https://www.mohfw.gov.in/pdf/FinalGuidanceonMangaementofCovidcasesversion2.pdf
owl:Class.rdfs:label: COVID-19 dedicated facility

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The diagnosis as COVID-19 patient. The diagnosied COVID-19 patients are categorised to three different categories/cases based on various clinical test and vital signs.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: COVID-19 Diagnosis

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Close contact, a suspected cause for catching COVID-19.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Close contact

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses which may cause illness in animals or humans. In humans, several coronaviruses are known to cause respiratory infections ranging from the common cold to more severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS). (source: https://www.who.int/news-room/q-a-detail/q-a-coronaviruses)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Coronavirus infection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Any facility, such as hotels/lodges/hostels/stadiums for providing care to COVID-19 patients are reffered as Covid Care Centre (CCC).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Covid Care Centre (CCC)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Dedicated COVID Health Centre are hospitals that shall offer care for all cases that have been clinically assigned as moderate.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dedicated Covid Health Centre (DCHC)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Dedicated COVID Hospitals are hospitals that shall offer comprehensive care primarily for those who have been clinically assigned as severe.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dedicated Covid Hospital (DCH)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: identifying the nature or cause of some phenomenon.
an impairment of health or a condition of abnormal functioning.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Disease

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A viral disease caused by coronavirus.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Disease caused by Coronaviridae

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An adminidtrative area spanning regions or counties, several municipalities, subdivisions of municipalities, school district, or political district.
A licensed medical practitioner.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Doctor
Medical practitioner

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Suspected causes of catching COVID-19.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Exposure to COVID-19

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Mass gathering, a suspected cause for catching COVID-19.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Gathering

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The laboratory test finding of the patient. The possible values are Positive, Negative, Pending.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Laboratory test finding

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A man.
Cases presenting with fever and/or upper respiratory tract illness (Influenza Like Illness, ILI).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Mild and very mild COVID-19

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Pneumonia with no signs of severe disease (Respiratory Rate 15 to 30/minute, SpO2 90%-94%).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Moderate COVID-19

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A health professional skilled in caring for young children or the sick (usually under the supervision of a physician).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Nurse
Professional nurse

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Severe Pneumonia (with respiratory rate ≥30/minute and/or SpO2 < 90% in room air) or ARDS or Septic shock.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Severe COVID-19

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Statistics based on each day.
Statistics of COVID-19 cases which includes the deatils of active, recovered, deaths, and also the resources (e.g., beds required, shortage of beds, ICUs) on daily basis.
A test result.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Test result

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The vital signs of a suspected covid-19 patient as found through clinical tests.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Vital signs

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A women.
An agent (eg. person, group, software or physical artifact).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Agent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A group of people who work together.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Organization

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A human being.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Person

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A country.
An enumeration of genders.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Gender type

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An infectious disease is a clinically evident human disease resulting from the presence of pathogenic microbial agents, like pathogenic viruses, pathogenic bacteria, fungi, protozoa, multicellular parasites, and prions. To be considered an infectious disease, such pathogens are known to be able to cause this disease.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Infectious disease

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A patient is any person recipient of health care services.

Patients are categorised into three groups based on the following guidelines.
Source: https://www.mohfw.gov.in/pdf/FinalGuidanceonMangaementofCovidcasesversion2.pdf
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Patient

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.
A state or province of a country.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Mild and Very Mild Covid19 Diagnostic Rule
